dataIdInfo.idPurp: A proof-of-concept ArcGIS Pro Python Toolbox demonstrating configuration-driven tool development using YAML files. Eliminates boilerplate code through dynamic tool generation.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This toolbox provides a modern approach to ArcGIS Pro Python Toolbox development
by using YAML configuration files to define tools instead of writing repetitive
wrapper classes. Tools are dynamically generated at runtime, allowing developers
to focus on business logic while the framework handles parameter management,
validation, and ArcGIS Pro integration.

Features:
- Zero boilerplate - Define tools in YAML, write only business logic
- Automatic parameter management with type validation
- Runtime validation rules defined in configuration
- Comprehensive metadata documentation support
- Self-documenting through YAML configuration
- Easy to test with mocked arcpy
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Developed as a proof of concept for YAML-based ArcGIS Pro Python Toolbox development. Demonstrates modern software engineering practices including configuration-driven development, dynamic code generation, and comprehensive testing strategies.

Consts.useLimit:
This toolbox is provided as-is for demonstration and educational purposes only.
Users may freely use, modify, and distribute this software subject to the
following conditions:
- Not intended for production use without thorough testing and validation
- No warranty expressed or implied for fitness for any particular purpose
- Users assume all responsibility for results and data quality
- Organizations should verify compliance with local data usage policies
- Consult with GIS administrators before deploying in enterprise environments
